Description: Gold finger-ring; stirrup-shaped with an oval bezel with the Egyptian hieroglyphic inscription: "Maat the golden one, of the two lands"; above is a vulture; design probably cast and chased; either Egyptian production or Cypriot or Levantine Egyptianising style.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (1)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 302)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 62)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P43, Pl VIII)
